metadata.title: Stochastic Compartmental Modelling of SARS-CoV-2 with Approximate Bayesian Computation

abstract.original_text: In this proof-of-concept study, we model the spread of SARS-CoV-2 in various environments with a stochastic susceptible-infectious-recovered (SIR) compartmental model. We fit this model to the latest epidemic data with an approximate Bayesian computation (ABC) technique. Within this SIR-ABC framework, we extrapolate long-term infection curves for several regions and evaluate their steepness. We propose several applications and extensions of the SIR-ABC technique.

sentences.segment_text: In this proof-of-concept study , we model the spread of SARS-CoV-2 in various environments with a stochastic susceptible-infectious-recovered ( SIR ) compartmental model .
We fit this model to the latest epidemic data with an approximate Bayesian computation ( ABC ) technique .
Within this SIR-ABC framework , we extrapolate long-term infection curves for several regions and evaluate their steepness .
We propose several applications and extensions of the SIR-ABC technique .
